description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Slack is where work happens. It's a collaboration hub where the right people and the right information come together, helping everyone get work done.Our Developer Platform supports this mission by providing an engagement layer connecting people and information across different software. A typical enterprise has over one thousand pieces of software, creating silos of data and events! Our goal is to empower everyone to automate admin tasks and exchange data between silos to reduce context switching, increase productivity, and improve their working life.In this role you'll work with our developer ecosystem to create delightful interactive experiences connecting third-party systems within Slack to reduce context switching and spread knowledge sharing.Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, creative, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?What You Will Be Doing Owning a product strategy and feature roadmap to deliver on the needs of people who build Slack apps across a range of technical levels and capabilities. Building an understanding of Slack app developers, both inside and outside large organizations. Creating new APIs to allow easier creation of new Slack app capabilities. Launching new services to support Slack developers and reduce friction for Slack development. You will build fundamentals that enable and grow the ecosystem of apps that connect Slack to productivity applications, together with our partner-facing teams. In tandem with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable launch of new functionality for developers and Slack customers. Drive execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with partners. Prioritize and design features for a variety of personas, from non-technical Slack users to Slack power-users to developers Understanding Slack user, administrator, developer, and partner dynamics to build healthy ecosystems What you should have 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on technical products, especially APIs and developer platforms. A passion for Slack and the problems we are solving Desire to understand Slack developers and users of varying skill levels and technical capabilities - their capabilities, needs, and how they work Ability to manage complex internal and external stakeholders and find creative solutions Track record of working with engineering and partner teams: people want to work with you again Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . job_title: Product Manager - Customization (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
description: Do you love helping teams be more efficient and get their jobs done easier and better? Are you a champion of the latest technologies like 3D modeling and rendering? If so, our Product Manager, Customization role could be the perfect fit!In this role, you will help modernize the tools and workflows that power our footwear customization business. To do that, you'll translate the business needs of our operators into productized workflows and features that will power our business for years to come. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering solutions for Nike’s world-wide Operations teams and has a track record of conceiving, building, and improving digital experiences that change the way users interact with their tools every day.You will be enabling Nike to push the boundaries of 3D experiences for our consumers and internal teams! You'll prioritize building trust with our Operations, Engineering and Program partners to identify the real problem that needs to be solved, develop a strategy for migrating users to a new platform and deliver on that strategy. Our best Product Managers are detail oriented, data driven, consumer focused and outstanding communicators who work well across a diverse set of partner teams to deliver best in class solutions.As the Product Manager in our Core Commerce Decide team, you will be working with the customization squads as the owner of our Customization Lab and Customization Experience teams. You will drive the complete our 3D platform migration including the go-to-market and cutover strategies through cross-functional collaboration and leading our Scrum/Agile ceremonies with engineering teams and communicating plans and progress. You will also collaborate with the Director of Product, Decide to obsess what the future of these tools could be to help our Product Creation partners and craft a roadmap for them. To be successful, you’ll collaborate with and influence partners, deeply empathize with our users, and measure performance of key product-health metrics.Key ResponsibilitiesManagement of Feature Development for Customization Tools and ExperiencesPro-active Definition of Feature Specifications: Partner with other Product Managers and Experience Design to develop wireframes while defining user requirements in collaboration with multiple engineering teamsChampion consumer-centricity: Live your customer’s reality - both your Operations consumers AND the millions of global Nike shoppers who use our experiences to customize and buy footwearEnsure a smooth cutover of all partners to our new tooling and experiences and lead the way for new user groups and the capabilities they need to adopt themExhibit a Bias for Delivery: Participate in Agile ceremonies and keep the cross functional team passionate about near term opportunities in a constantly evolving environmentCommunication & Collaboration: Clearly articulate the product objectives and how they are measured, our roadmap priorities, and requirements to multiple teams in both written and oral formats. Gather and incorporate feedback from a diverse group of partners including app and web teams, capability teams, consumers, business teams, operational teams, and legalSet a higher standard: Promote cross-team and cross-organizational sharing of knowledge QualificationsBachelor's degree or higher or equivalent combination of education and experience and training3+ years of relevant work experience, working as a Product Manager on Agile development teams passionate about global digital products, preferably within the domain of digital commerceStrong analytical background and/or relevant data driven job experienceOutstanding problem solving, with emphasis on data driven decision makingHigh attention to detail including documenting requirementsOutstanding communication and decision-making skillsOpen to remote work, except cannot work in South Dakota, Vermont, and West Virginia. These candidates will be required to relocate.For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $117,000 per year. Information about benefits can be found here. Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries Footwear Manufacturing

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Slack is where work happens. It's a collaboration hub where the right people and the right information come together, helping everyone get work done.Our Developer Platform supports this mission by providing an engagement layer connecting people and information across different software. A typical enterprise has over one thousand pieces of software, creating silos of data and events! Our goal is to empower everyone to automate admin tasks and exchange data between silos to reduce context switching, increase productivity, and improve their working life.In this role you'll work with our developer ecosystem to create delightful interactive experiences connecting third-party systems within Slack to reduce context switching and spread knowledge sharing.Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, creative, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?What You Will Be Doing Owning a product strategy and feature roadmap to deliver on the needs of people who build Slack apps across a range of technical levels and capabilities. Building an understanding of Slack app developers, both inside and outside large organizations. Creating new APIs to allow easier creation of new Slack app capabilities. Launching new services to support Slack developers and reduce friction for Slack development. You will build fundamentals that enable and grow the ecosystem of apps that connect Slack to productivity applications, together with our partner-facing teams. In tandem with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable launch of new functionality for developers and Slack customers. Drive execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with partners. Prioritize and design features for a variety of personas, from non-technical Slack users to Slack power-users to developers Understanding Slack user, administrator, developer, and partner dynamics to build healthy ecosystems What you should have 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on technical products, especially APIs and developer platforms. A passion for Slack and the problems we are solving Desire to understand Slack developers and users of varying skill levels and technical capabilities - their capabilities, needs, and how they work Ability to manage complex internal and external stakeholders and find creative solutions Track record of working with engineering and partner teams: people want to work with you again Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.On the Quantitative Tools team at Tinder, our mission is to build trustworthy, fast, and powerful tools that anybody can easily use to turn data into practical information. Our scope includes platforms that enable anyone to build and consume insights into the impacts of product and market changes and the causes for metric movements and anomalies. Engineers, designers, product managers, analysts, and executives use our tools regularly.As an Associate Product Manager, your duties will include owning the development of data products, supporting our users, and improving how we conduct data-informed decision-making. Success in this role involves partnering with diverse cross-departmental collaborators, assessing opportunities, specifying requirements, and ensuring the delivery of projects to a schedule. Meaningful experience could include a technical background, research, analysis of large data sets, design thinking, and leading projects and teams.This position reports to the Senior Product Manager of Experimentation.You will: Determine and specify product requirements, functionality, and usage by partnering with cross-functional team members (product, engineering, market, and analytics).Capture and analyze product data, including analytics, statistics, and industry trends.Develop an efficient and reliable customer feedback and communication channels.Build marketing feature launches while onboarding new hires.You have:Familiarity with quantitative research, behavioral analysis and marketing techniques; SQL a plus, not mandatory.An understanding of consumer technology and online applications.Strong time management, collaboration, and communication skills.Proven experience navigating ambiguity and finding creative solutions.Passion for Tinder and our mission to keep the magic of human connection alive.Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, applied math, cognitive, behavioral, data science, or an equivalent is preferred.As part of our team, you’ll enjoy: Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy A robust Learning + Development offering including our MentorMatch program, access to a library of 6,000+ online learning courses through Udemy, and an annual L+D stipend Access to mental health resources Fertility preservation benefits No Meeting Wednesdays and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through Perkspot Charitable donations match up to $15,000 annually Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workouts The opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience. Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries Social Networking Platforms

United's Digital Technology team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics and digital solutions.Our Values: At United Airlines, we believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. Our Shared Purpose: "Connecting people. Uniting the world." drives us to be the best airline for our employees, customers and everyone we serve and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. Our team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation.With multiple employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities and world-class benefits like health insurance, parental leave and space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work that will make you feel welcome and accepted. Come join our team and help us make a positive impact on the world.Job overview and responsibilitiesWithin this Product Manager role at United Airlines, you will be responsible for multiple projects impacting the digital technology teams. You will be part of the Strategy and Planning team, maintaining the team roadmap, managing work intake and ensuring the team delivers on commitments effectively and efficiently.Analyze and define efficient, cost effective solutions to support company objectives, dept objectives, business processes and functional requirementsDefine and communicate the roadmap for services within your domainEnsure the roadmap supports company objectives and aligns with company prioritiesInteract with business partners, enterprise project teams and channel teams to understand their needs and prioritiesConduct and participate in the analysis of business processes and functional requirementsPrepare appropriate documentation to communicate and validate the informationReview and validate QA test plansSupport the QA team during test executionMaintain capacity management plans for the team, ensuring roadmaps align with team capacityMonitor progress of deliverables, keep dependent teams and projects informed on progressTake corrective action if deliverable cannot be met or if higher priorities disrupt prior commitmentsUnited Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.QualificationsRequired Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business related field and/or equivalent work experienceExperience working with cross-functional, global teams to deliver commitments on-time and on-budget5+ years of software product managementSolid knowledge of product management best practices, functional design and application delivery methodologyKnowledge of methodologies, tools and techniques for specific products; ability to develop product line processes and strategiesStrong multi-tasker, proven experience handling multiple roles and projects simultaneouslyExcellent analysis, problem solving and decision-making skillsAttention to detailStrong planning & organizational skillsStrong communication skills - verbal, written and presentationProficiency with Microsoft Office, Visio and TFSMust be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorshipSuccessful completion of interview required to meet job qualificationReliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the positionPreferredExperienced with both agile and waterfallExperience using JIRAKnowledge of project management methodology and some project managementAviation industry knowledgeEqual Opportunity Employer – Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTHSC00000583 Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Full-time Job function General Business Industries Airlines and Aviation

Creative Production and Promotion sits at the intersection of the consumer experience and the Netflix Studio. Our team is integral to making the Netflix experience feel personal and relevant by developing innovative approaches to how we promote, localize and release content. Because our products touch both members and content creators, we seek someone who can fluidly move among both worlds, applying strong product principles and strategic frameworks to the member experience, while deeply empathizing with the art and craft required to create great content. An ideal candidate is someone who is forward-thinking, future-oriented, and practically-minded.We localize our product to over 35 languages. As the Product Manager leading our localization efforts, your job will be to make Netflix and our content feel local for our members around the world. You will lead a cross-functional team of designers, engineers, data scientists, and linguists to push the boundaries for our localization experiences. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways and the boldness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, a balance of creativity and analytic skills, and exceptional organizational influence.About This RoleThis position operates at a senior level, owning critical decisions and progress in this domain. Some of the questions this leader will work through: How do we make the Netflix experience culturally relevant in every language we support? How do we empower teams across Netflix to self-service their localization needs? How do we localize our titles and promotional content?At Netflix, our product team is small, so you will have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate on the vision and strategy for Localization at Netflix. Lead the formation of an experimentation strategy alongside Data Science and Algorithm teams.Work with teams around the globe to roll out products to our talent, the studio, and partners.Lead cross-functional teams including design, engineering, and data science to discover and execute opportunities.Communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization.What We’re Looking ForProven record of successfully launching global products or platforms.Experience with machine learning, algorithms, and experimentation.Exceptional analytical skills.Experience with localization and translation is a plusAbility to mobilize the entire organization towards a common goal.A rigorous approach to developing strategy and execution.Demonstrated understanding of good UX.Ability to prioritize well and articulate your plan across business functions and geographies.Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead designers and engineers. Show more Show less Seniority level Not Applicable Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries Movies and Sound Recording, Internet Publishing, and Entertainment Providers

About The CompanyIn 2008, Gwyneth Paltrow launched goop, a lifestyle platform dedicated to keeping its readership informed and inspired with tightly curated content and products. goop's expert tastemakers advise and contribute on everything from fashion, wellness, and travel, to recipes, parenting, and cultural issues. Pioneering the contextual commerce platform, goop allows readers to shop with meaning. goop is one of the rare places on the web where food, shopping, and mindfulness collide—where the ever-evolving intent is to make every choice count. We're all resource-strapped, so goop hopes to surface the very best experiences, recipes, products, and advice.With a highly engaged and loyal customer base already in place, the goop platform is rapidly expanding to include branded events, retail stores, pop-ups, a Netflix series, and an ever-growing lineup of goop private label products in addition to multi-branded shopping. The company boasts diverse and rapidly growing revenue streams across ecommerce, ad sales, retail, and experiences. goop is headquartered in Santa Monica, CA.About YouYou are passionate about the goop brand and have a strong desire to build and improve our digital product. You may already be a confident leader who has experience guiding cross-functional teams in the successful creation of products that improve the consumer experience, utilizing innovative optimization techniques to drive business impact. You lead with a data-driven and problem-solving mindset. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative culture.About The RoleIn this role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with internal and external stakeholders to enhance the website user experience through experimentation, and optimizations as well as develop new features to improve acquisition, engagement, and conversion. You will manage all aspects of product development from problem identification to launch and will be critical in supporting our overall digital product strategy and its related testing and feature roadmap. This role will report directly to the Lead Product Manager.Engage regularly with business stakeholders to gather and define new requirements, identify inefficiencies, and set expectations for in-progress roadmap items. Establish a deep understanding of the user experience, identify and fill product gaps, and generate new ideas that inspire new and existing customers by leveraging data, user research, and competitive analysis. Turn our strategic vision into reality by partnering with the engineering team and cross-functional stakeholders to create an aligned product roadmap Communicate product status, key issues, and launch plans to key stakeholders throughout the organization Partner with product designers, developers, and internal stakeholders for discovery and user research Translate business needs, user needs, and technological capabilities into user stories and product requirements working closely with the engineering and QA teams. Manage a squad and run all the ceremonies of a proper Agile scrum development cycle including stand-ups, sprint planning, and retros. Continuously iterate on our product workflows to help us work more effectively Qualifications & ExperienceExcellent Communicator: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate technical and business concepts to technical and non-technical audiences. Entrepreneurial Spirit: Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, deals well with ambiguity and focuses on delivering quantifiable business or customer value. Analytically Grounded: You define what success looks like with real data, taking into account user experience, KPIs, and how to measure progress holistically. You know every step of the user funnel. You can design, run, and interpret experiments and A/B tests Technical Problem-solver: You dive deep to understand technically complex systems to come up with creative solutions and carefully consider how changes will impact the business and customers. Growth Mindset: You acknowledge that everyone has room to grow, believe that delivering and receiving feedback is healthy, and enjoy the thrill of discovery and learning. Data Enthusiast: You use data to ground discovery efforts and prioritization decisions, discover insights, and communicate the value and impact of the work you do. Collaborative Decider: You build buy-in and involve the appropriate perspectives in the decision-making process but feel comfortable being decisive and making tough calls. Scrum Product Ownership: You can take a vision and roadmap and turn it into an impactful scrum board comprised of epics and stories that your cross-functional product teams will understand and build. You also love leading and participating in sprint reviews where results are demonstrated, not only functional but also business-impacting achievements FAQ Compensation: Competitive Market Salary DOE + Equity. Benefits: Generous health benefits package, fertility benefits and paid parental leave. Perks: "goopcation" paid company summer break, generous goop discounts, special offers with brand partners, access to custom lifestyle resources and events, and a beautiful workspace in Santa Monica Work Philosophy: At goop, we believe that creativity, innovation, and camaraderie are essential to our business, our culture, and our employee's growth and development. With our Hybrid Work Policy, we are committed to promoting collaboration, productivity, and employee well-being by maximizing the benefits of both in-person and remote work. With every aspect of this policy, goop is committed to employee health and safety and will continue to follow all federal, state, and local requirements. Type of Hire: This is a Full-Time Exempt Staff position. Other candidates, consultants, and placement agency candidates will not be considered. Job Disclosures: No applicant disclosures related to physical requirements or ADA-related considerations are relevant for this role Application Requirements: All applicants will be reviewed through Greenhouse submission. Direct submissions to the People Operations Team members will not be reviewed separately. Candidate Requirements: Applicant must have US work authorization. goop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. goop does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. All information provided by the applicant is collected, stored and processed in accordance with the terms of our Privacy Policy Show more Show less Seniority level Entry level Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries Internet News

Company DescriptionTwitter is what’s happening and what people are talking about right now. For us, life&aposs not about a job, it&aposs about purpose. We believe real change starts with conversation. Here, your voice matters. Come as you are and together we&aposll do what&aposs right (not what&aposs easy) to serve the public conversation.Job DescriptionAre you passionate about defending online users from abuse, spam, and manipulation? Will you be proud to work on real-time, scalable systems to launch new product lines with integrity? If so, you should join us. Health is Twitter’s top priority, and we need your help!Here Are Some Examples Of What You’ll DoLead the effort to accelerate Health onboarding for new products. Own requirements, design, and implementation of onboarding products to ensure new customer launches have the reporting, detection, and remediation capabilities they needImprove our approach to ensuring Health protections across ever-increasing use cases. Inform product roadmaps, priorities, and designs for partner teams to enable easy integrationDrive team strategy and support execution against it, including identifying product opportunities and continuously iterating on market fit and team processes to maintain a strong cultureQualificationsYou have experience with distributed systems in a production setting, including the technical and analytical depth to partner with engineers. Ideally, you have past experience as an engineer or similar technical knowledge, and past work on platforms and API products.You thrive in navigating and making sense of ambiguity. You focus on customers, develop concrete strategies, and drive execution against them.You enjoy working in a collaborative environment and interact effectively with others.You bring thoughtful perspectives, empathy, and creativity to solve problems at scale.You’re willing to be mentored and to mentor others. As teams scale in size and in their use of Figma, wayfinding across and within teams, projects, and files becomes highly challenging. The Discovery team’s mission is to help Figma users find, organize and stay up-to-date on their work within Figma. We aim to make it easier for users to find their files (through the File Browser and Search), and also notify users about important updates relating to their work (through Notifications and 3rd party integrations).The Discovery team is part of the Collaboration pillar at Figma. Collaboration is Figma’s “secret sauce”, a core competitive advantage. As the Discovery PM, you’ll help advance our vision of an open and accessible design platform, by making it easier for teammates to find and weigh in on design work happening within their teams and organizations. You will also have a chance to be part of a fast-growing startup that is hungry for innovation and an incredibly talented PM team to learn from and partner with!This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.What you’ll do at Figma:Develop a strategy and vision for the File Browser (including search & navigation)Establish our Notifications platform and partner with other Product teams to ensure the quality and engagement of our notifications. Direct message the job poster from VeeOne Health Cherie Thurman Connecting Healthcare Providers with Telehealth and Virtual Care Solutions Sr. Product Manager Do you want to work in an awesome culture developed by leadership from Silicon Valley startups and major healthcare systems? Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing telehealth companies in the nation? Where you won’t be micromanaged? A place with unlimited rapid career growth possibilities? This is it. About Us Based in Roseville, CA, VeeOne Health is a global telehealth company focused on virtual technology, physician services, and operations. Founded in 2016, VeeOne Health has the most advanced telemedicine solutions available for the entire continuum of care, from acute care to outpatient settings. VeeOne Health’s advanced platform powers its entire suite of solutions, allowing for healthcare systems to seamlessly deliver the highest quality, timely, and life-saving care – regardless of location. VeeOne Health’s virtual care platform is there for every step of the patient journey. Read more about us here: www.VeeOneHealth.com. Our atmosphere is fun, creative, smart, and hard-working. We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a healthcare or technology company — we’re a powerhouse that provides solutions to improve people’s lives. We’re revolutionizing the way healthcare functions, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion to help us keep on innovating. We pride ourselves on a world-class winning culture of collaboration and teamwork. We are a mission-driven company that works on what really matters — improving the quality and accessibility of healthcare globally. Everywhere you look at the healthcare technology that surrounds us you'll find one thing in common. It all relies on quality. That's why VeeOne Health is dedicated to providing healthcare solutions that are more reliable, efficient, and effective. It is because quality matters. We are confident we can deliver on this promise because of the attributes that our employees embody. We're ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent, and we're committed to learning. These values enable us to tackle some of the toughest challenges on the planet for our customers, never losing sight of what matters. Who we are looking for? We’re looking for candidates who have the following:Ability to multitask and work effectively across projects/products while liaising with various stakeholders.Self-Motivated team player who has high emotional intelligence and a history of guiding product roadmaps (preferably in the health care space).A deep understanding of and experience working in Software-as-a-Service (SaaS).Start-up minded; an out-of-the box thinker who is unafraid to wear multiple hats and finds opportunities in the face of uncertainty and change.Approaches challenges with dogged tenacity to overcome obstacles.Possesses highly effective communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.Compensation & Benefits Competitive compensation package (equity included) along with benefits (health, dental, vision). Responsibilities· Wear multiple hats and collaborate closely with engineering, marketing, sales, business development, customer success, QA, and other teams when necessary.· Translate the product strategy into detailed requirements for designers to do high-fidelity prototypes and for the final product development done by engineering.· Create product strategy documents that describe business and high-level use cases, technical requirements, and ROI.· Thoroughly analyze market data to develop sales strategies and clearly define product objectives for effective marketing communications plans.· Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates VeeOne Health and its features across primary market segments, specifically in the RPM space.· Drive the execution of product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch. Qualifications· Proven track record with a minimum of 2+ years of experience as product manager (preferable in the telemedicine space).· Bachelor’s in computer science, engineering, product design, or equivalent.· Proven experience in driving products from inception to launch and overseeing all elements of the product development lifecycle.· Strong proficiency for technical workflow tools (Azure DevOps, JIRA, etc.), and the agile/scrum development process. Preferred Qualifications· 5+ years of product management or relevant work experience.· Experience in health tech, specifically in inpatient/outpatient, direct to patient, and remote patient monitoring (RPM) and virtual-care-as-a-service (VCaaS). · Certified Product Owner (CSPO).If you have a real passion for product management and healthcare technology, this is just the opportunity you need to launch a successful career at VeeOne Health. Ready to connect your skills and knowledge with our innovative health tech solutions? It starts with you. Explore our opportunities and apply today. Show more Show less Employment type Full-time

Memora Health has worked with over 50 healthcare organizations to make complex care journeys simple for patients and clinicians so that care is more accessible, actionable, and always-on. Our team is rapidly growing as we expand our programs to reach more health systems and patients, and we are excited to bring on a Product Manager for Patient Engagement . In this role, you will have the critical responsibility of owning our patient-facing automated messaging and natural language experiences, improving the quality of interactions and accuracy of responses.As part of our Product team, you will work closely with multiple parts of the organization in this cross-functional role, including ongoing collaboration with our Clinical Programs, Design and Engineering teams, as well as supporting and engaging with our Growth, Customer Success, Implementations teams.You should be driven both by the problems we are solving and also by the innovative approach and technologies that we are applying to healthcare. Primary Responsibilities:Managing our automated messaging capabilities, including systems that provide guidance to and collect information from patientsImprove the accuracy, performance and overall experience for patients engaging with our natural language systemsEnhancing the processing and handoffs between different systems and users communicating in the same threadExtending our capabilities outside of SMS, including phone calls/IVR and emailCoordinating closely with our Clinical Programs team on required functionality and enhancements, and with our Internal Tools product team on the interfaces to setup and manage of patient-facing systems Qualifications (Required):2+ years experience working in a B2B/enterprise product role - we are open to considering both junior and senior candidates for this roleExperience with patient or consumer engagement solutions, including SMS-based systemsExperience with products that make use of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) systems Track record of owning strategy for products/product suites/lines of businessStrong analytics and data-driven approach to prioritization and roadmap development Qualifications (Bonus):Experience in healthcareTechnical backgroundPrior work at a startup What You Get:Improve the way care is delivered for thousands of patients by shaping how healthcare organizations approach patient outreach and engagementWork at a high-growth, venture-backed health tech companyBuild and scale Memora alongside a world-class teamCompetitive salary and equity compensationBenefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, and a 401(k) planFully paid parental leaveUnlimited PTO and 10 paid company holidaysRemote-friendly workplace with bi-annual retreats About Memora:Memora Health helps healthcare organizations digitize and automate care journeys, making complex care delivery simple for patients and clinicians to navigate. Memora Health ingests existing data on clinical workflows, converts them into cohesive messaging journeys that guide patients through their care episodes, and automates the completion of simple follow-up tasks in the EHR. Memora's platform reduces care team notifications by nearly 40%, has an average patient NPS over 70, and improves clinical outcomes across various populations. Memora Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with clients and team members around the world, and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Transformation Capital, AlleyCorp, Frist Cressey Ventures, Martin Ventures, Kevin Durant and Rich Kleiman's Thirty Five Ventures, Sachin Jain, and several other strategic healthcare groups. This person will collaborate across the business to craft the product vision and drive the product roadmap for the migration from our existing Communications platform to their new Communications platform. Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We seek to increase the creative capacity of the world. We give everyone – from everyday communicators to emerging artists to global brands – what they need to craft and deliver exceptional experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to build breathtaking and powerful images, videos, and applications, and transforming how companies interact with customers across every screen.The challengeCrafting meaningful content is more valuable than ever before. Creative Cloud has a long history of providing the industry’s best applications for producing content of any type – from digital to print to video. Today, creatives are under greater and greater pressure to build more content in less time. They are increasingly seeking and expecting a seamless workflow across their many devices and applications, so they can use the right tool for the right job. They want to capture content anywhere, organize their images, brushes, color palettes, and iconography for reuse, work together on creative documents, and easily share renditions of content for feedback. Crafting a cohesive and seamless flow for creative collaboration across all of our creative tools is a crucial part of the Creative Cloud strategy – and our team is at the heart of it.Our team defines and develops the collaborative capabilities unique to creativity. We work in close partnership with teams across Creative Cloud including apps, platform, and go-to-market. The workflows we release enable creative teams to work efficiently and openly, leveraging the cloud. We truly believe in the value of Adobe’s ecosystem of creative applications and their differentiation when used in concert.What You’ll DoThis role will drive the strategy and roadmap of Creative Cloud Libraries experiences within other Creative Cloud products, ensuring a consistent experience for Libraries across all products. You will partner with designers, engineers, and business team members to deliver products and features which redefine collaboration and remove friction for creatives and their teams.What You’ll Need To SucceedAt least 5+ yrs of proven product management experienceExperience in one or more of the following areas is a plus: design, SaaS products, creative tooling or APIsDedication to understanding customers and building outstanding customer experiencesStrong writing skills and an ability to use those to persuade othersComplex troubleshooting skills driven by critical thinkingProven analytical skills and the ability to make decisions using both quantitative and qualitative dataSkills for analyzing trends, understanding customer needs and translating these into strategies for feature developmentAbility to work effectively in collaborative, cross-functional teams Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Advertising Services, and Software Development

About UpstartUpstart is a leading AI lending platform partnering with banks and credit unions to expand access to affordable credit. As we transitioned to being a public company, we’re now poised to leverage our domain expertise and revolutionize every aspect of lending and credit risk evaluation. We’ve recently expanded our offerings to include automobile refinancing and we plan to take on more verticals as the business grows.By leveraging Upstart's AI platform, Upstart-powered banks and credit unions can have higher approval rates and lower loss rates, while simultaneously delivering the exceptional digital-first lending experience their customers demand. Upstart's patent-pending platform is the first to receive a no-action letter from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau related to fair lending. Upstart not only supports a large remote workforce, but also has offices in San Mateo, CA; Columbus, OH; and Austin, TX.Most Upstarters join us because they connect with our mission of enabling access to effortless credit based on true risk. If you are energized by the impact you can make at Upstart, we’d love to hear from you!About This RoleUpstart is looking for a Senior Product Manager to help us achieve our mission of enabling effortless credit based on true risk. You will play a large role in shaping both the MVP as well as the development roadmap as we scale.As a Senior product manager, you will work closely with our engineers and machine learning experts to guide products from conception to launch. You will design and develop technologies that deepen our relationships with customers, helping Upstart’s to deliver increasing value to borrowers over time. You will also play an important part in imagining our next moonshots.One of the reasons Upstart has experienced such rapid growth is because of the clear-eyed, analytical approach we take to product enhancements. The right candidate for this role should be highly capable, able to organize both ideas and people, and excel at problem solving of many kinds. You should have a bias toward action and be able to break down complex problems into steps that drive rapid product development. You will bridge the technical and business worlds as you first design services that our customers love and then engage stakeholders to make them a reality. By clearly defining requirements and removing blockers, you will act as a multiplier on the productivity of your team.Position Location - This role is available across the US.Time Zone Requirements - This team operates in all US time zones.Travel Requirements - This team has regular on-site collaboration sessions. These occur 2-3 days per Month at our San Mateo or Columbus office. If you need to travel to make these meetups, Upstart will cover all travel related expenses.How you’ll make an impact:Make smart trade-offs to inform the ongoing product roadmap, prioritizing the features with the highest ROI and experimenting when necessaryPassionately advocate for a customer experience that leads to extreme customer loyaltyCollaborate with machine learning and marketing to balance unit economics with long-term customer valueDemonstrate and encourage best practices in product management by working with other PMs throughout the companyMake this nascent line of business successful in meeting the needs of customers and attracting material market shareHere is what we are looking for:BA/BS in Economics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.5-7 years of product management experience at a computationally heavy growth-stage company. Experience bringing a new product from concept to launch to scale.Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment, and to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends; excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills.Passion and aptitude for credit and financing-related economic concepts.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with a product that relies on machine-learning.Demonstrated ability to excel in informal or formal product leadership responsibilities.Experience bringing teams together using Agile development methodology.Experience building online finance products, and/or knowledge of the consumer finance market.What you’ll love: Competitive Compensation (base + bonus & equity)Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coveragePersonal Development and Technology & Ergonomic Budgets Life insurance and disability benefits Clubs and Activities (Game Nights, Fitstarters, Superwomen, Book Club, Investing Club, Money Discussions, Photography Club and Basketball teams) Generous vacation policy401(k) and Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)Catered lunches + snacks & drinksUpstart is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to ensuring that underrepresented classes receive better access to affordable credit, and are just as committed to embracing diversity and inclusion in our hiring practices. We celebrate all cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, and know that we can only become better together.https://www.upstart.com/candidate_privacy_policy Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries Financial Services

At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit - one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities.This position contributes to Starbucks success by assuming responsibility for the strategic value, capabilities, and performance of cross-company technology solutions in support of the Licensed Store business. We design, build, and nurture a technology ecosystem that elevates the Starbucks brand and grows our business. To be successful, the senior product manager needs to be an expert in managing complex and ambiguous initiatives while managing cross functional expectations - including but not limited to product roadmaps, feature sets, problem areas, timelines, and change requests. They need to have a passion for building the right capabilities for our business and our customers balanced with the analytical rigor to test, measure, and iterate to deliver on the best experience and business value through complex solutions that provide exceptional capabilities to drive decision making, optimization, financial performance, and operational excellence for the Licensed Store business.Summary Of Key ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities and essential job functions include, but are not limited to, the following:Partners with business stakeholders on problem definition & drive alignment on business goals, UX goals and defining target KPIs for the overall product and features. Creates user stories/requirements, works with stakeholders to identify ROI/business value; leads prioritization of backlog; Creates and maintains user personasEffectively partners and collaborates with both senior managers and working teams to position and support engagementsPrioritization and ownership across multiple deliverables and cross-team initiativesResponsible for multiple sub-products and/or one small to mid-size product. Knowledgeable in a specific product domain space within Starbucks and the overall industry.Able to manage tradeoffs on scope, resources, timeline on small to medium sized feature setsResponsible for successful execution of small to medium enhancements and new features against business goalsCommunicates effectively with technology and business teams independentlyCreates product update communications independently varying from release announcements to content for executive review and decision makingSupports team members and peers in learning technical skills and business acumenStays abreast of new technology capabilities and leverages knowledge in contributing to product solutions. Recommends and plans innovative products and features.Works with technical product managers and/or engineering to scope and prioritize upcoming projects into the roadmapCollaborates with technical working teams to apply knowledge/expertise in refining requirements, understanding technical debt and non-functional features to prioritize appropriatelyManages a cross-team product roadmapBuilds effective relationships with key stakeholders and cross functional teamsPerforms Feature Readouts with 2nd level insights (broader and deeper hypothesis driven complete analysis) per measurement plan, identify proxy data sources as needed to troubleshoot issues.QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field Demonstrated ability to work with design and engineering to deliver large cross functional business process and systems transformations across the following domains: relationship management, product development, category/marketing, supply chain planning and execution, and finance (4 years) Hands on experience in developing roadmaps, priorities, features, story outlines, writing user stories, refining product backlogs, and coordinating/prioritizing conflicting requirements in a fast-paced, changing environment with variety of stakeholders (5 years) Managing product delivery and release in an agile environment (3 years) Industry experience in a technology environment with a record of successfully delivering complex products (5 years) Leadership, creative thinking, and problem-solving skillsDrive to get things done and a desire to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with varied responsibilities.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. High attention to detail and the ability to effectively lead multiple projects at a timeComfortable with change and ability to adapt accordingly. This is an innovative and fast growth part of the company where products and processes evolve rapidly Teamwork skills essential; sense of humor preferredAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com. Creative Production and Promotion sits at the intersection of the consumer experience and the Netflix Studio. Our team is integral to making the Netflix experience feel personal and relevant by developing innovative approaches to how we promote, localize and release content. Because our products touch both members and content creators, we seek someone who can fluidly move among both worlds, applying strong product principles and strategic frameworks to the member experience, while deeply empathizing with the art and craft required to create great content. An ideal candidate is someone who is forward-thinking, future-oriented, and practically-minded.We localize our product to over 35 languages. As the Product Manager leading our localization efforts, your job will be to make Netflix and our content feel local for our members around the world. You will lead a cross-functional team of designers, engineers, data scientists, and linguists to push the boundaries for our localization experiences. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways and the boldness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, a balance of creativity and analytic skills, and exceptional organizational influence.About This RoleThis position operates at a senior level, owning critical decisions and progress in this domain. Some of the questions this leader will work through: How do we make the Netflix experience culturally relevant in every language we support? How do we empower teams across Netflix to self-service their localization needs? How do we localize our titles and promotional content?At Netflix, our product team is small, so you will have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate on the vision and strategy for Localization at Netflix. Lead the formation of an experimentation strategy alongside Data Science and Algorithm teams.Work with teams around the globe to roll out products to our talent, the studio, and partners.Lead cross-functional teams including design, engineering, and data science to discover and execute opportunities.Communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization.What We’re Looking ForProven record of successfully launching global products or platforms.Experience with machine learning, algorithms, and experimentation.Exceptional analytical skills.Experience with localization and translation is a plusAbility to mobilize the entire organization towards a common goal.A rigorous approach to developing strategy and execution.Demonstrated understanding of good UX.Ability to prioritize well and articulate your plan across business functions and geographies.Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead designers and engineers. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Slack is where work happens. It's a collaboration hub where the right people and the right information come together, helping everyone get work done.Our Developer Platform supports this mission by providing an engagement layer connecting people and information across different software. A typical enterprise has over one thousand pieces of software, creating silos of data and events! Our goal is to empower everyone to automate admin tasks and exchange data between silos to reduce context switching, increase productivity, and improve their working life.In this role you'll work with our developer ecosystem to create delightful interactive experiences connecting third-party systems within Slack to reduce context switching and spread knowledge sharing.Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, creative, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?What You Will Be Doing Owning a product strategy and feature roadmap to deliver on the needs of people who build Slack apps across a range of technical levels and capabilities. Building an understanding of Slack app developers, both inside and outside large organizations. Creating new APIs to allow easier creation of new Slack app capabilities. Launching new services to support Slack developers and reduce friction for Slack development. You will build fundamentals that enable and grow the ecosystem of apps that connect Slack to productivity applications, together with our partner-facing teams. In tandem with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable launch of new functionality for developers and Slack customers. Drive execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with partners. Prioritize and design features for a variety of personas, from non-technical Slack users to Slack power-users to developers Understanding Slack user, administrator, developer, and partner dynamics to build healthy ecosystems What you should have 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on technical products, especially APIs and developer platforms. A passion for Slack and the problems we are solving Desire to understand Slack developers and users of varying skill levels and technical capabilities - their capabilities, needs, and how they work Ability to manage complex internal and external stakeholders and find creative solutions Track record of working with engineering and partner teams: people want to work with you again Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . United's Digital Technology team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics and digital solutions.Our Values: At United Airlines, we believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. Our Shared Purpose: "Connecting people. Uniting the world." drives us to be the best airline for our employees, customers and everyone we serve and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. Our team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation.With multiple employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities and world-class benefits like health insurance, parental leave and space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work that will make you feel welcome and accepted. Come join our team and help us make a positive impact on the world.Job overview and responsibilitiesWithin this Product Manager role at United Airlines, you will be responsible for multiple projects impacting the digital technology teams. You will be part of the Strategy and Planning team, maintaining the team roadmap, managing work intake and ensuring the team delivers on commitments effectively and efficiently.Analyze and define efficient, cost effective solutions to support company objectives, dept objectives, business processes and functional requirementsDefine and communicate the roadmap for services within your domainEnsure the roadmap supports company objectives and aligns with company prioritiesInteract with business partners, enterprise project teams and channel teams to understand their needs and prioritiesConduct and participate in the analysis of business processes and functional requirementsPrepare appropriate documentation to communicate and validate the informationReview and validate QA test plansSupport the QA team during test executionMaintain capacity management plans for the team, ensuring roadmaps align with team capacityMonitor progress of deliverables, keep dependent teams and projects informed on progressTake corrective action if deliverable cannot be met or if higher priorities disrupt prior commitmentsUnited Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.QualificationsRequired Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business related field and/or equivalent work experienceExperience working with cross-functional, global teams to deliver commitments on-time and on-budget5+ years of software product managementSolid knowledge of product management best practices, functional design and application delivery methodologyKnowledge of methodologies, tools and techniques for specific products; ability to develop product line processes and strategiesStrong multi-tasker, proven experience handling multiple roles and projects simultaneouslyExcellent analysis, problem solving and decision-making skillsAttention to detailStrong planning & organizational skillsStrong communication skills - verbal, written and presentationProficiency with Microsoft Office, Visio and TFSMust be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorshipSuccessful completion of interview required to meet job qualificationReliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the positionPreferredExperienced with both agile and waterfallExperience using JIRAKnowledge of project management methodology and some project managementAviation industry knowledgeEqual Opportunity Employer – Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTHSC00000583 Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Full-time Job function General Business Industries Airlines and Aviation

Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.On the Quantitative Tools team at Tinder, our mission is to build trustworthy, fast, and powerful tools that anybody can easily use to turn data into practical information. Our scope includes platforms that enable anyone to build and consume insights into the impacts of product and market changes and the causes for metric movements and anomalies. Engineers, designers, product managers, analysts, and executives use our tools regularly.As an Associate Product Manager, your duties will include owning the development of data products, supporting our users, and improving how we conduct data-informed decision-making. Success in this role involves partnering with diverse cross-departmental collaborators, assessing opportunities, specifying requirements, and ensuring the delivery of projects to a schedule. Meaningful experience could include a technical background, research, analysis of large data sets, design thinking, and leading projects and teams.This position reports to the Senior Product Manager of Experimentation.You will: Determine and specify product requirements, functionality, and usage by partnering with cross-functional team members (product, engineering, market, and analytics).Capture and analyze product data, including analytics, statistics, and industry trends.Develop an efficient and reliable customer feedback and communication channels.Build marketing feature launches while onboarding new hires.You have:Familiarity with quantitative research, behavioral analysis and marketing techniques; SQL a plus, not mandatory.An understanding of consumer technology and online applications.Strong time management, collaboration, and communication skills.Proven experience navigating ambiguity and finding creative solutions.Passion for Tinder and our mission to keep the magic of human connection alive.Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, applied math, cognitive, behavioral, data science, or an equivalent is preferred.As part of our team, you’ll enjoy: Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy A robust Learning + Development offering including our MentorMatch program, access to a library of 6,000+ online learning courses through Udemy, and an annual L+D stipend Access to mental health resources Fertility preservation benefits No Meeting Wednesdays and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through Perkspot Charitable donations match up to $15,000 annually Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workouts The opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience. Direct message the job poster from Insight Global Jack Joyce Recruiter at Insight Global Job Description:One of Insight Global’s top financial clients is looking for a Product Manager to join their Enterprise Communications & Storage Platform team within GSG Capabilities. This person will collaborate across the business to craft the product vision and drive the product roadmap for the migration from our existing Communications platform to their new Communications platform. This candidate is expected to map and understand end-to-end customer journeys and opportunities for improvement, define and prioritize a roadmap of features and enhancements to improve the customer experience and drive business value, and drive the migration from our existing platforms to the new platform. The product manager will partner with key stakeholders on the development of this migration roadmap and will participate actively in all phases of the development process with the Engineering team, designers, and architects to deliver the right user experience, and with partners from other lines of business and Operations leaders to ensure proper operational readiness and change management for new features and enhancements. Core ResponsibilitiesWork with key partners, colleagues and leadership to define and articulate a product strategy and roadmap with clearly defined business metrics and targets Communicate and build consensus across disciplines in crafting the product roadmap Translate product roadmap into well-defined product requirements and acceptance criteria Create a Product Backlog for a specific product Enable cross-functional collaboration with relevant teams within the product scope Appropriately identify and raise risks, challenges, opportunities to advance the teamPartner with Lines of business to enable change management Prioritize and maintain a backlog of features and enhancements consistent with the OutcomesPartner with the design and technology teams to develop, test and deliver the defined capabilities and rapidly iterate new solutions Works closely with analytics and uses internal data tools to understand measure success and impact to critical metrics, and to track performance to inform the roadmap Show more Show less Employment type Full-time

About GigXRGigXR makes it easy to create, deliver, and implement holographic training.Our Immersive Learning Platform:Simplifies the creation of mixed reality training;Delivers first- and third-party mixed reality applications for use in training curriculum;Enables one-stop shopping for all XR training needs;Streamlines implementation through a single dashboard for full curriculum implementation.Our first-party applications are created in partnership with leading institutions like University of Cambridge, Michigan Medicine, and Northwest Permanente P.C. Our platform also delivers third-party applications from market leading developers.We fundamentally believe mixed reality is the best medium to use for training, and work tirelessly to remove friction in its delivery and use.About the Product TeamThe Product team at GigXR is responsible for the research, definition, launch and support of all GigXR products and services. The products we create span:Our developer program powered by our SDKOur dashboard – called the Gig Management System (GMS) that enables customers to manage the applications they use on our platform to our GMS web interfaceThe mobile applications that enable iOS and Android devices to experience our hologramsOur mixed reality applications that run on the Microsoft HoloLens. As a member of our team, you’ll be collaborating across multiple teams, and working to solve problems across multiple devices, technologies, platforms and mediums. We love big visions, and solving big problems.About the Product Manager RoleOur product manager reports to our SVP of Product Management and is responsible for understanding customer needs, conducting research, gathering product requirements, partnering with design to conceptualize solutions, discussing scope and edge cases with the engineering team, analyzing product performance metrics, and bringing products to market.You will work with our QA, Engineering, Customer Success, Sales, and Product teams to ensure the product aligns with business objectives and exceeds customer expectations.What You Will Do:Collaborate with the product team to define product vision, requirements and roadmap.Scope and prioritize tasks and activities based on business goals and customer Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, create, test, and ship better designs, together. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!We’re looking for a self-motivated and user-oriented Product Manager to lead the Discovery team. As teams scale in size and in their use of Figma, wayfinding across and within teams, projects, and files becomes highly challenging. The Discovery team’s mission is to help Figma users find, organize and stay up-to-date on their work within Figma. We aim to make it easier for users to find their files (through the File Browser and Search), and also notify users about important updates relating to their work (through Notifications and 3rd party integrations).The Discovery team is part of the Collaboration pillar at Figma. Collaboration is Figma’s “secret sauce”, a core competitive advantage. As the Discovery PM, you’ll help advance our vision of an open and accessible design platform, by making it easier for teammates to find and weigh in on design work happening within their teams and organizations. You will also have a chance to be part of a fast-growing startup that is hungry for innovation and an incredibly talented PM team to learn from and partner with!This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.What you’ll do at Figma:Develop a strategy and vision for the File Browser (including search & navigation)Establish our Notifications platform and partner with other Product teams to ensure the quality and engagement of our notifications. Work closely with designers and engineers to define feature functionality and execute against this roadmap Do all the things you'd expect in a PM, like driving planning and prioritization, defining and tracking key metrics, collaborating on marketing, messaging, positioning, and go-to-market plansWe’d love to hear from you if you:Have experience successfully leading complex, user-facing product launchesHave deep user empathy and the ability to build relationships with key customersAre comfortable working on both technical platforms and user-facing featuresAre an excellent verbal and written communicator. You’re able to zoom in and out effortlessly based on the audience. You can rally and motivate a team behind a bold visionHave an affinity for the fast-paced, changing environment of a start-up, a sense of humor and get-it-done personalityAt Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. Direct message the job poster from Textline Stephanie Acevedo Recruiting @ Textline - we're hiring! Textline is on a mission to help companies improve their customer experience in fewer than 160 characters at a time. We are a business texting platform empowering businesses to communicate personally and more efficiently via text messages. We are adding a remote Product Manager, with a penchant for integrations, to help us build a world-class software application. The ideal applicant for this remote Product Manager position has a customer-first mindset with unique experience in working with integrations. You’ll work closely with the Product, Design, and Engineering teams (PDE) to research, develop, manage, and lead our integration roadmap. Textline is a robust platform with patented features and boasts many integrations already. Some of our integrations include Zendesk Sell, Zendesk Support, Freshdesk, Pipedrive, Salesforce, Chrome, and Slack. We are looking to dramatically expand our integrations to better serve our surging customer base.Textline is a lean team that is made up of highly talented individuals who are experts at their crafts and in their fields. Our mantra on the PDE team is to “Work hard and be nice to people.” Textline is an ideal place to work for those looking for autonomy in their day-to-day work, and influence over one of the industry’s leading software applications. What you’ll do at Textline:Oversee the integrations roadmap:Research appropriate integration opportunitiesInvestigate documentation to confirm functionalityWrite spec documents for integration opportunitiesPrioritize integrations alongside the feature roadmapOversee, QA, and test these integrationsWork toward improving existing integrationsKnow the product inside and outIdentify, prioritize, clarify, and triage bugsCollaborate with Product Design and Engineering to create stellar solutionsHelp to identify customer problemsInterview customers and prospects to understand their product needsBecome an expert at integrationsWhat you'll bring to Textline:Experience in understanding and working with APIsAn interactive mindset with a bias toward action and improvementWillingness to tackle the most complex problemsUser-focused empathy and passion for customersArticulate presentation skills with a knack for normalizing problemsCreative ideas for how disparate software can work togetherA willingness to study and understand Requirements:3+ Years of product management experienceDemonstrable writing and presentation skillsExamples of specs, roadmaps, and research documentsA background in working with web software and a working knowledge of APIsAbility to switch between thinking creatively and analyticallyTextline benefits include: Health, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k matching, unlimited vacation, FSA for dependent care or healthcare.More about Textline: We provide each new hire with a new Macbook and office equipment stipend to get your home-office set up as you wish. To foster your continued learning outside of your role, we offer weekly optional learning sessions, led by our c-suite. We also offer optional fitness classes/challenges and host monthly get-togethers on Zoom! We look forward to stepping away from our screens and getting together in person for gatherings when deemed safe!
