description: Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, create, test, and ship better designs, together. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!We’re looking for a self-motivated and user-oriented Product Manager to lead the Discovery team. As teams scale in size and in their use of Figma, wayfinding across and within teams, projects, and files becomes highly challenging. The Discovery team’s mission is to help Figma users find, organize and stay up-to-date on their work within Figma. We aim to make it easier for users to find their files (through the File Browser and Search), and also notify users about important updates relating to their work (through Notifications and 3rd party integrations).The Discovery team is part of the Collaboration pillar at Figma. Collaboration is Figma’s “secret sauce”, a core competitive advantage. As the Discovery PM, you’ll help advance our vision of an open and accessible design platform, by making it easier for teammates to find and weigh in on design work happening within their teams and organizations. You will also have a chance to be part of a fast-growing startup that is hungry for innovation and an incredibly talented PM team to learn from and partner with!This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.What you’ll do at Figma:Develop a strategy and vision for the File Browser (including search & navigation)Establish our Notifications platform and partner with other Product teams to ensure the quality and engagement of our notifications. Work closely with designers and engineers to define feature functionality and execute against this roadmap Do all the things you'd expect in a PM, like driving planning and prioritization, defining and tracking key metrics, collaborating on marketing, messaging, positioning, and go-to-market plansWe’d love to hear from you if you:Have experience successfully leading complex, user-facing product launchesHave deep user empathy and the ability to build relationships with key customersAre comfortable working on both technical platforms and user-facing featuresAre an excellent verbal and written communicator. You’re able to zoom in and out effortlessly based on the audience. You can rally and motivate a team behind a bold visionHave an affinity for the fast-paced, changing environment of a start-up, a sense of humor and get-it-done personalityAt Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.Read more about our teamInvesting in Figma: The Decade of DesignHow work is changing at FigmaFigma's next product is a multiplayer whiteboard called FigJamSoftware Design Startup Figma Is Now Worth $10 BillionWe will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please let your recruiter know if you require accommodation.About FigmaDylan Field and Evan Wallace co-founded Figma in 2012 with the vision of building tools for designers in the browser. Their goal was to create the first design tool that combined the accessibility of the Web with the functionality of a native app. Today Figma is a platform with tools and spaces to support the entire product development process—idea to design to build—and has simplified collaboration for companies like Microsoft, Uber, and The New York Times to name a few.At Figma, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse backgrounds, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, products, and community to flourish. Figma is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with the applicable candidate section of Figma's Privacy Policy. To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Slack is where work happens. It's a collaboration hub where the right people and the right information come together, helping everyone get work done.Our Developer Platform supports this mission by providing an engagement layer connecting people and information across different software. A typical enterprise has over one thousand pieces of software, creating silos of data and events! Our goal is to empower everyone to automate admin tasks and exchange data between silos to reduce context switching, increase productivity, and improve their working life.In this role you'll work with our developer ecosystem to create delightful interactive experiences connecting third-party systems within Slack to reduce context switching and spread knowledge sharing.Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, creative, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?What You Will Be Doing Owning a product strategy and feature roadmap to deliver on the needs of people who build Slack apps across a range of technical levels and capabilities. Building an understanding of Slack app developers, both inside and outside large organizations. Creating new APIs to allow easier creation of new Slack app capabilities. Launching new services to support Slack developers and reduce friction for Slack development. You will build fundamentals that enable and grow the ecosystem of apps that connect Slack to productivity applications, together with our partner-facing teams. In tandem with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable launch of new functionality for developers and Slack customers. Drive execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with partners. Prioritize and design features for a variety of personas, from non-technical Slack users to Slack power-users to developers Understanding Slack user, administrator, developer, and partner dynamics to build healthy ecosystems What you should have 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on technical products, especially APIs and developer platforms. A passion for Slack and the problems we are solving Desire to understand Slack developers and users of varying skill levels and technical capabilities - their capabilities, needs, and how they work Ability to manage complex internal and external stakeholders and find creative solutions Track record of working with engineering and partner teams: people want to work with you again Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.On the Quantitative Tools team at Tinder, our mission is to build trustworthy, fast, and powerful tools that anybody can easily use to turn data into practical information. Our scope includes platforms that enable anyone to build and consume insights into the impacts of product and market changes and the causes for metric movements and anomalies. Engineers, designers, product managers, analysts, and executives use our tools regularly.As an Associate Product Manager, your duties will include owning the development of data products, supporting our users, and improving how we conduct data-informed decision-making. Success in this role involves partnering with diverse cross-departmental collaborators, assessing opportunities, specifying requirements, and ensuring the delivery of projects to a schedule. Meaningful experience could include a technical background, research, analysis of large data sets, design thinking, and leading projects and teams.This position reports to the Senior Product Manager of Experimentation.You will: Determine and specify product requirements, functionality, and usage by partnering with cross-functional team members (product, engineering, market, and analytics).Capture and analyze product data, including analytics, statistics, and industry trends.Develop an efficient and reliable customer feedback and communication channels.Build marketing feature launches while onboarding new hires.You have:Familiarity with quantitative research, behavioral analysis and marketing techniques; SQL a plus, not mandatory.An understanding of consumer technology and online applications.Strong time management, collaboration, and communication skills.Proven experience navigating ambiguity and finding creative solutions.Passion for Tinder and our mission to keep the magic of human connection alive.Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, applied math, cognitive, behavioral, data science, or an equivalent is preferred.As part of our team, you’ll enjoy: Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy A robust Learning + Development offering including our MentorMatch program, access to a library of 6,000+ online learning courses through Udemy, and an annual L+D stipend Access to mental health resources Fertility preservation benefits No Meeting Wednesdays and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through Perkspot Charitable donations match up to $15,000 annually Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workouts The opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience. Creative Production and Promotion sits at the intersection of the consumer experience and the Netflix Studio. Our team is integral to making the Netflix experience feel personal and relevant by developing innovative approaches to how we promote, localize and release content. Because our products touch both members and content creators, we seek someone who can fluidly move among both worlds, applying strong product principles and strategic frameworks to the member experience, while deeply empathizing with the art and craft required to create great content. An ideal candidate is someone who is forward-thinking, future-oriented, and practically-minded.We localize our product to over 35 languages. As the Product Manager leading our localization efforts, your job will be to make Netflix and our content feel local for our members around the world. You will lead a cross-functional team of designers, engineers, data scientists, and linguists to push the boundaries for our localization experiences. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways and the boldness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, a balance of creativity and analytic skills, and exceptional organizational influence.About This RoleThis position operates at a senior level, owning critical decisions and progress in this domain. Some of the questions this leader will work through: How do we make the Netflix experience culturally relevant in every language we support? How do we empower teams across Netflix to self-service their localization needs? How do we localize our titles and promotional content?At Netflix, our product team is small, so you will have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate on the vision and strategy for Localization at Netflix. Lead the formation of an experimentation strategy alongside Data Science and Algorithm teams.Work with teams around the globe to roll out products to our talent, the studio, and partners.Lead cross-functional teams including design, engineering, and data science to discover and execute opportunities.Communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization.What We’re Looking ForProven record of successfully launching global products or platforms.Experience with machine learning, algorithms, and experimentation.Exceptional analytical skills.Experience with localization and translation is a plusAbility to mobilize the entire organization towards a common goal.A rigorous approach to developing strategy and execution.Demonstrated understanding of good UX.Ability to prioritize well and articulate your plan across business functions and geographies.Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead designers and engineers. About The CompanyIn 2008, Gwyneth Paltrow launched goop, a lifestyle platform dedicated to keeping its readership informed and inspired with tightly curated content and products. goop's expert tastemakers advise and contribute on everything from fashion, wellness, and travel, to recipes, parenting, and cultural issues. Pioneering the contextual commerce platform, goop allows readers to shop with meaning. goop is one of the rare places on the web where food, shopping, and mindfulness collide—where the ever-evolving intent is to make every choice count. We're all resource-strapped, so goop hopes to surface the very best experiences, recipes, products, and advice.With a highly engaged and loyal customer base already in place, the goop platform is rapidly expanding to include branded events, retail stores, pop-ups, a Netflix series, and an ever-growing lineup of goop private label products in addition to multi-branded shopping. The company boasts diverse and rapidly growing revenue streams across ecommerce, ad sales, retail, and experiences. goop is headquartered in Santa Monica, CA.About YouYou are passionate about the goop brand and have a strong desire to build and improve our digital product. You may already be a confident leader who has experience guiding cross-functional teams in the successful creation of products that improve the consumer experience, utilizing innovative optimization techniques to drive business impact. You lead with a data-driven and problem-solving mindset. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative culture.About The RoleIn this role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with internal and external stakeholders to enhance the website user experience through experimentation, and optimizations as well as develop new features to improve acquisition, engagement, and conversion. You will manage all aspects of product development from problem identification to launch and will be critical in supporting our overall digital product strategy and its related testing and feature roadmap. This role will report directly to the Lead Product Manager.Engage regularly with business stakeholders to gather and define new requirements, identify inefficiencies, and set expectations for in-progress roadmap items. Establish a deep understanding of the user experience, identify and fill product gaps, and generate new ideas that inspire new and existing customers by leveraging data, user research, and competitive analysis. Turn our strategic vision into reality by partnering with the engineering team and cross-functional stakeholders to create an aligned product roadmap Communicate product status, key issues, and launch plans to key stakeholders throughout the organization Partner with product designers, developers, and internal stakeholders for discovery and user research Translate business needs, user needs, and technological capabilities into user stories and product requirements working closely with the engineering and QA teams. Manage a squad and run all the ceremonies of a proper Agile scrum development cycle including stand-ups, sprint planning, and retros. Continuously iterate on our product workflows to help us work more effectively Qualifications & ExperienceExcellent Communicator: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate technical and business concepts to technical and non-technical audiences. Entrepreneurial Spirit: Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, deals well with ambiguity and focuses on delivering quantifiable business or customer value. Analytically Grounded: You define what success looks like with real data, taking into account user experience, KPIs, and how to measure progress holistically. You know every step of the user funnel. You can design, run, and interpret experiments and A/B tests Technical Problem-solver: You dive deep to understand technically complex systems to come up with creative solutions and carefully consider how changes will impact the business and customers. Growth Mindset: You acknowledge that everyone has room to grow, believe that delivering and receiving feedback is healthy, and enjoy the thrill of discovery and learning. Data Enthusiast: You use data to ground discovery efforts and prioritization decisions, discover insights, and communicate the value and impact of the work you do. Collaborative Decider: You build buy-in and involve the appropriate perspectives in the decision-making process but feel comfortable being decisive and making tough calls. Scrum Product Ownership: You can take a vision and roadmap and turn it into an impactful scrum board comprised of epics and stories that your cross-functional product teams will understand and build. You also love leading and participating in sprint reviews where results are demonstrated, not only functional but also business-impacting achievements FAQ Compensation: Competitive Market Salary DOE + Equity. Benefits: Generous health benefits package, fertility benefits and paid parental leave. Perks: "goopcation" paid company summer break, generous goop discounts, special offers with brand partners, access to custom lifestyle resources and events, and a beautiful workspace in Santa Monica Work Philosophy: At goop, we believe that creativity, innovation, and camaraderie are essential to our business, our culture, and our employee's growth and development. With our Hybrid Work Policy, we are committed to promoting collaboration, productivity, and employee well-being by maximizing the benefits of both in-person and remote work. With every aspect of this policy, goop is committed to employee health and safety and will continue to follow all federal, state, and local requirements. Type of Hire: This is a Full-Time Exempt Staff position. Other candidates, consultants, and placement agency candidates will not be considered. Job Disclosures: No applicant disclosures related to physical requirements or ADA-related considerations are relevant for this role Application Requirements: All applicants will be reviewed through Greenhouse submission. Direct submissions to the People Operations Team members will not be reviewed separately. Candidate Requirements: Applicant must have US work authorization. goop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. goop does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Memora Health has worked with over 50 healthcare organizations to make complex care journeys simple for patients and clinicians so that care is more accessible, actionable, and always-on. Our team is rapidly growing as we expand our programs to reach more health systems and patients, and we are excited to bring on a Product Manager for Patient Engagement . In this role, you will have the critical responsibility of owning our patient-facing automated messaging and natural language experiences, improving the quality of interactions and accuracy of responses.As part of our Product team, you will work closely with multiple parts of the organization in this cross-functional role, including ongoing collaboration with our Clinical Programs, Design and Engineering teams, as well as supporting and engaging with our Growth, Customer Success, Implementations teams.You should be driven both by the problems we are solving and also by the innovative approach and technologies that we are applying to healthcare. Primary Responsibilities:Managing our automated messaging capabilities, including systems that provide guidance to and collect information from patientsImprove the accuracy, performance and overall experience for patients engaging with our natural language systemsEnhancing the processing and handoffs between different systems and users communicating in the same threadExtending our capabilities outside of SMS, including phone calls/IVR and emailCoordinating closely with our Clinical Programs team on required functionality and enhancements, and with our Internal Tools product team on the interfaces to setup and manage of patient-facing systems Qualifications (Required):2+ years experience working in a B2B/enterprise product role - we are open to considering both junior and senior candidates for this roleExperience with patient or consumer engagement solutions, including SMS-based systemsExperience with products that make use of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) systems Track record of owning strategy for products/product suites/lines of businessStrong analytics and data-driven approach to prioritization and roadmap development Qualifications (Bonus):Experience in healthcareTechnical backgroundPrior work at a startup What You Get:Improve the way care is delivered for thousands of patients by shaping how healthcare organizations approach patient outreach and engagementWork at a high-growth, venture-backed health tech companyBuild and scale Memora alongside a world-class teamCompetitive salary and equity compensationBenefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, and a 401(k) planFully paid parental leaveUnlimited PTO and 10 paid company holidaysRemote-friendly workplace with bi-annual retreats About Memora:Memora Health helps healthcare organizations digitize and automate care journeys, making complex care delivery simple for patients and clinicians to navigate. Memora Health ingests existing data on clinical workflows, converts them into cohesive messaging journeys that guide patients through their care episodes, and automates the completion of simple follow-up tasks in the EHR. Memora's platform reduces care team notifications by nearly 40%, has an average patient NPS over 70, and improves clinical outcomes across various populations. Memora Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with clients and team members around the world, and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Transformation Capital, AlleyCorp, Frist Cressey Ventures, Martin Ventures, Kevin Durant and Rich Kleiman's Thirty Five Ventures, Sachin Jain, and several other strategic healthcare groups. Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, create, test, and ship better designs, together. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!We’re looking for a founding PM to lead our Growth Platform product team. This PM will empower the next level of growth by building a growth infrastructure for all of Figma, which directly impacts our ability to scale. Figma is growing at an exceptional rate and this Product manager has the opportunity to not just move the needle, but accelerate us into our next phase of growth as a company.The Growth Platform Team works cross-functionally with Marketing, Data Science, and Product - the team sit at the intersection of these domains and is in an exceptional position to build an amazing product these teams love and drive x-company growth. From our experiment framework, localization platform, analytics pipelines and more. We’ve bootstrapped many of these tools with manual processes, but at our scale this simply doesn't work anymore.What you’ll do at Figma:Talk to company leaders and teams to identify and synthesize the highest impact growth platform initiatives across the company into a cohesive vision and strategy Collaborate with product managers, analytics, engineering, and data science teams to gather feedback and requirements for Figma’s internal analytics and experiment products (experimentation platform, analytics pipeline, features flags, etc)Partner with our marketing department to build tools that enable a modern experimentation driven approach to marketing that maximizes Figma’s marketing impact and reachBuild capabilities for the to enable fast paced and iterative product development, gathering feedback and requirements for Figma’s internal content delivery APIs (e.g. Localization Frameworks, Email Content Frameworks, etc)We'd love to hear from you if you:Get excited by beautifully crafted platform products and understand the impact a great platform product can have on a companyAre able to rally and motivate a team behind a bold visionCan expertly discuss technical trade-offs with the team and simplify for non technical stakeholdersHave an affinity for the fast-paced, ambiguous environment of a start-up and a get-it-done attitudeAt Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.Read more about our teamInvesting in Figma: The Decade of DesignHow work is changing at FigmaFigma's next product is a multiplayer whiteboard called FigJamSoftware Design Startup Figma Is Now Worth $10 BillionWe will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Their goal was to create the first design tool that combined the accessibility of the Web with the functionality of a native app. Today Figma is a platform with tools and spaces to support the entire product development process—idea to design to build—and has simplified collaboration for companies like Microsoft, Uber, and The New York Times to name a few.At Figma, we celebrate and support our differences. Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We seek to increase the creative capacity of the world. We give everyone – from everyday communicators to emerging artists to global brands – what they need to craft and deliver exceptional experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to build breathtaking and powerful images, videos, and applications, and transforming how companies interact with customers across every screen.The challengeCrafting meaningful content is more valuable than ever before. Creative Cloud has a long history of providing the industry’s best applications for producing content of any type – from digital to print to video. Today, creatives are under greater and greater pressure to build more content in less time. They are increasingly seeking and expecting a seamless workflow across their many devices and applications, so they can use the right tool for the right job. They want to capture content anywhere, organize their images, brushes, color palettes, and iconography for reuse, work together on creative documents, and easily share renditions of content for feedback. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Slack is where work happens. It's a collaboration hub where the right people and the right information come together, helping everyone get work done.Our Developer Platform supports this mission by providing an engagement layer connecting people and information across different software. A typical enterprise has over one thousand pieces of software, creating silos of data and events! Our goal is to empower everyone to automate admin tasks and exchange data between silos to reduce context switching, increase productivity, and improve their working life.In this role you'll work with our developer ecosystem to create delightful interactive experiences connecting third-party systems within Slack to reduce context switching and spread knowledge sharing.Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, creative, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?What You Will Be Doing Owning a product strategy and feature roadmap to deliver on the needs of people who build Slack apps across a range of technical levels and capabilities. Building an understanding of Slack app developers, both inside and outside large organizations. Creating new APIs to allow easier creation of new Slack app capabilities. Launching new services to support Slack developers and reduce friction for Slack development. You will build fundamentals that enable and grow the ecosystem of apps that connect Slack to productivity applications, together with our partner-facing teams. In tandem with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable launch of new functionality for developers and Slack customers. Drive execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with partners. Prioritize and design features for a variety of personas, from non-technical Slack users to Slack power-users to developers Understanding Slack user, administrator, developer, and partner dynamics to build healthy ecosystems What you should have 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on technical products, especially APIs and developer platforms. A passion for Slack and the problems we are solving Desire to understand Slack developers and users of varying skill levels and technical capabilities - their capabilities, needs, and how they work Ability to manage complex internal and external stakeholders and find creative solutions Track record of working with engineering and partner teams: people want to work with you again Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . job_title: Product Manager - Customization (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
description: Do you love helping teams be more efficient and get their jobs done easier and better? Are you a champion of the latest technologies like 3D modeling and rendering? If so, our Product Manager, Customization role could be the perfect fit!In this role, you will help modernize the tools and workflows that power our footwear customization business. To do that, you'll translate the business needs of our operators into productized workflows and features that will power our business for years to come. We are looking for someone who is passionate about delivering solutions for Nike’s world-wide Operations teams and has a track record of conceiving, building, and improving digital experiences that change the way users interact with their tools every day.You will be enabling Nike to push the boundaries of 3D experiences for our consumers and internal teams! You'll prioritize building trust with our Operations, Engineering and Program partners to identify the real problem that needs to be solved, develop a strategy for migrating users to a new platform and deliver on that strategy. Our best Product Managers are detail oriented, data driven, consumer focused and outstanding communicators who work well across a diverse set of partner teams to deliver best in class solutions.As the Product Manager in our Core Commerce Decide team, you will be working with the customization squads as the owner of our Customization Lab and Customization Experience teams. You will drive the complete our 3D platform migration including the go-to-market and cutover strategies through cross-functional collaboration and leading our Scrum/Agile ceremonies with engineering teams and communicating plans and progress. You will also collaborate with the Director of Product, Decide to obsess what the future of these tools could be to help our Product Creation partners and craft a roadmap for them. To be successful, you’ll collaborate with and influence partners, deeply empathize with our users, and measure performance of key product-health metrics.Key ResponsibilitiesManagement of Feature Development for Customization Tools and ExperiencesPro-active Definition of Feature Specifications: Partner with other Product Managers and Experience Design to develop wireframes while defining user requirements in collaboration with multiple engineering teamsChampion consumer-centricity: Live your customer’s reality - both your Operations consumers AND the millions of global Nike shoppers who use our experiences to customize and buy footwearEnsure a smooth cutover of all partners to our new tooling and experiences and lead the way for new user groups and the capabilities they need to adopt themExhibit a Bias for Delivery: Participate in Agile ceremonies and keep the cross functional team passionate about near term opportunities in a constantly evolving environmentCommunication & Collaboration: Clearly articulate the product objectives and how they are measured, our roadmap priorities, and requirements to multiple teams in both written and oral formats. Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, create, test, and ship better designs, together. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!We’re looking for a self-motivated and user-oriented Product Manager to lead the Discovery team. As teams scale in size and in their use of Figma, wayfinding across and within teams, projects, and files becomes highly challenging. The Discovery team’s mission is to help Figma users find, organize and stay up-to-date on their work within Figma. We aim to make it easier for users to find their files (through the File Browser and Search), and also notify users about important updates relating to their work (through Notifications and 3rd party integrations).The Discovery team is part of the Collaboration pillar at Figma. Collaboration is Figma’s “secret sauce”, a core competitive advantage. As the Discovery PM, you’ll help advance our vision of an open and accessible design platform, by making it easier for teammates to find and weigh in on design work happening within their teams and organizations. You will also have a chance to be part of a fast-growing startup that is hungry for innovation and an incredibly talented PM team to learn from and partner with!This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.What you’ll do at Figma:Develop a strategy and vision for the File Browser (including search & navigation)Establish our Notifications platform and partner with other Product teams to ensure the quality and engagement of our notifications. Work closely with designers and engineers to define feature functionality and execute against this roadmap Do all the things you'd expect in a PM, like driving planning and prioritization, defining and tracking key metrics, collaborating on marketing, messaging, positioning, and go-to-market plansWe’d love to hear from you if you:Have experience successfully leading complex, user-facing product launchesHave deep user empathy and the ability to build relationships with key customersAre comfortable working on both technical platforms and user-facing featuresAre an excellent verbal and written communicator. You’re able to zoom in and out effortlessly based on the audience. You can rally and motivate a team behind a bold visionHave an affinity for the fast-paced, changing environment of a start-up, a sense of humor and get-it-done personalityAt Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.Read more about our teamInvesting in Figma: The Decade of DesignHow work is changing at FigmaFigma's next product is a multiplayer whiteboard called FigJamSoftware Design Startup Figma Is Now Worth $10 BillionWe will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please let your recruiter know if you require accommodation.About FigmaDylan Field and Evan Wallace co-founded Figma in 2012 with the vision of building tools for designers in the browser. Their goal was to create the first design tool that combined the accessibility of the Web with the functionality of a native app. Today Figma is a platform with tools and spaces to support the entire product development process—idea to design to build—and has simplified collaboration for companies like Microsoft, Uber, and The New York Times to name a few.At Figma, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse backgrounds, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, products, and community to flourish. Figma is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with the applicable candidate section of Figma's Privacy Policy. Memora Health has worked with over 50 healthcare organizations to make complex care journeys simple for patients and clinicians so that care is more accessible, actionable, and always-on. Our team is rapidly growing as we expand our programs to reach more health systems and patients, and we are excited to bring on a Product Manager for Patient Engagement . In this role, you will have the critical responsibility of owning our patient-facing automated messaging and natural language experiences, improving the quality of interactions and accuracy of responses.As part of our Product team, you will work closely with multiple parts of the organization in this cross-functional role, including ongoing collaboration with our Clinical Programs, Design and Engineering teams, as well as supporting and engaging with our Growth, Customer Success, Implementations teams.You should be driven both by the problems we are solving and also by the innovative approach and technologies that we are applying to healthcare. Primary Responsibilities:Managing our automated messaging capabilities, including systems that provide guidance to and collect information from patientsImprove the accuracy, performance and overall experience for patients engaging with our natural language systemsEnhancing the processing and handoffs between different systems and users communicating in the same threadExtending our capabilities outside of SMS, including phone calls/IVR and emailCoordinating closely with our Clinical Programs team on required functionality and enhancements, and with our Internal Tools product team on the interfaces to setup and manage of patient-facing systems Qualifications (Required):2+ years experience working in a B2B/enterprise product role - we are open to considering both junior and senior candidates for this roleExperience with patient or consumer engagement solutions, including SMS-based systemsExperience with products that make use of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) systems Track record of owning strategy for products/product suites/lines of businessStrong analytics and data-driven approach to prioritization and roadmap development Qualifications (Bonus):Experience in healthcareTechnical backgroundPrior work at a startup What You Get:Improve the way care is delivered for thousands of patients by shaping how healthcare organizations approach patient outreach and engagementWork at a high-growth, venture-backed health tech companyBuild and scale Memora alongside a world-class teamCompetitive salary and equity compensationBenefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, and a 401(k) planFully paid parental leaveUnlimited PTO and 10 paid company holidaysRemote-friendly workplace with bi-annual retreats About Memora:Memora Health helps healthcare organizations digitize and automate care journeys, making complex care delivery simple for patients and clinicians to navigate. Memora Health ingests existing data on clinical workflows, converts them into cohesive messaging journeys that guide patients through their care episodes, and automates the completion of simple follow-up tasks in the EHR. Memora's platform reduces care team notifications by nearly 40%, has an average patient NPS over 70, and improves clinical outcomes across various populations. Memora Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with clients and team members around the world, and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Transformation Capital, AlleyCorp, Frist Cressey Ventures, Martin Ventures, Kevin Durant and Rich Kleiman's Thirty Five Ventures, Sachin Jain, and several other strategic healthcare groups. Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We seek to increase the creative capacity of the world. We give everyone – from everyday communicators to emerging artists to global brands – what they need to craft and deliver exceptional experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to build breathtaking and powerful images, videos, and applications, and transforming how companies interact with customers across every screen.The challengeCrafting meaningful content is more valuable than ever before. Creative Cloud has a long history of providing the industry’s best applications for producing content of any type – from digital to print to video. Today, creatives are under greater and greater pressure to build more content in less time. They are increasingly seeking and expecting a seamless workflow across their many devices and applications, so they can use the right tool for the right job. They want to capture content anywhere, organize their images, brushes, color palettes, and iconography for reuse, work together on creative documents, and easily share renditions of content for feedback. Crafting a cohesive and seamless flow for creative collaboration across all of our creative tools is a crucial part of the Creative Cloud strategy – and our team is at the heart of it.Our team defines and develops the collaborative capabilities unique to creativity. We work in close partnership with teams across Creative Cloud including apps, platform, and go-to-market. The workflows we release enable creative teams to work efficiently and openly, leveraging the cloud. We truly believe in the value of Adobe’s ecosystem of creative applications and their differentiation when used in concert.What You’ll DoThis role will drive the strategy and roadmap of Creative Cloud Libraries experiences within other Creative Cloud products, ensuring a consistent experience for Libraries across all products. You will partner with designers, engineers, and business team members to deliver products and features which redefine collaboration and remove friction for creatives and their teams.What You’ll Need To SucceedAt least 5+ yrs of proven product management experienceExperience in one or more of the following areas is a plus: design, SaaS products, creative tooling or APIsDedication to understanding customers and building outstanding customer experiencesStrong writing skills and an ability to use those to persuade othersComplex troubleshooting skills driven by critical thinkingProven analytical skills and the ability to make decisions using both quantitative and qualitative dataSkills for analyzing trends, understanding customer needs and translating these into strategies for feature developmentAbility to work effectively in collaborative, cross-functional teams Show more Show less Seniority level Mid-Senior level Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries IT Services and IT Consulting, Advertising Services, and Software Development

About UpstartUpstart is a leading AI lending platform partnering with banks and credit unions to expand access to affordable credit. As we transitioned to being a public company, we’re now poised to leverage our domain expertise and revolutionize every aspect of lending and credit risk evaluation. We’ve recently expanded our offerings to include automobile refinancing and we plan to take on more verticals as the business grows.By leveraging Upstart's AI platform, Upstart-powered banks and credit unions can have higher approval rates and lower loss rates, while simultaneously delivering the exceptional digital-first lending experience their customers demand. Upstart's patent-pending platform is the first to receive a no-action letter from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau related to fair lending. Upstart not only supports a large remote workforce, but also has offices in San Mateo, CA; Columbus, OH; and Austin, TX.Most Upstarters join us because they connect with our mission of enabling access to effortless credit based on true risk. If you are energized by the impact you can make at Upstart, we’d love to hear from you!About This RoleUpstart is looking for a Senior Product Manager to help us achieve our mission of enabling effortless credit based on true risk. You will play a large role in shaping both the MVP as well as the development roadmap as we scale.As a Senior product manager, you will work closely with our engineers and machine learning experts to guide products from conception to launch. You will design and develop technologies that deepen our relationships with customers, helping Upstart’s to deliver increasing value to borrowers over time. You will also play an important part in imagining our next moonshots.One of the reasons Upstart has experienced such rapid growth is because of the clear-eyed, analytical approach we take to product enhancements. The right candidate for this role should be highly capable, able to organize both ideas and people, and excel at problem solving of many kinds. You should have a bias toward action and be able to break down complex problems into steps that drive rapid product development. You will bridge the technical and business worlds as you first design services that our customers love and then engage stakeholders to make them a reality. By clearly defining requirements and removing blockers, you will act as a multiplier on the productivity of your team.Position Location - This role is available across the US.Time Zone Requirements - This team operates in all US time zones.Travel Requirements - This team has regular on-site collaboration sessions. These occur 2-3 days per Month at our San Mateo or Columbus office. If you need to travel to make these meetups, Upstart will cover all travel related expenses.How you’ll make an impact:Make smart trade-offs to inform the ongoing product roadmap, prioritizing the features with the highest ROI and experimenting when necessaryPassionately advocate for a customer experience that leads to extreme customer loyaltyCollaborate with machine learning and marketing to balance unit economics with long-term customer valueDemonstrate and encourage best practices in product management by working with other PMs throughout the companyMake this nascent line of business successful in meeting the needs of customers and attracting material market shareHere is what we are looking for:BA/BS in Economics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.5-7 years of product management experience at a computationally heavy growth-stage company. Experience bringing a new product from concept to launch to scale.Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment, and to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends; excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills.Passion and aptitude for credit and financing-related economic concepts.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with a product that relies on machine-learning.Demonstrated ability to excel in informal or formal product leadership responsibilities.Experience bringing teams together using Agile development methodology.Experience building online finance products, and/or knowledge of the consumer finance market.What you’ll love: Competitive Compensation (base + bonus & equity)Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coveragePersonal Development and Technology & Ergonomic Budgets Life insurance and disability benefits Clubs and Activities (Game Nights, Fitstarters, Superwomen, Book Club, Investing Club, Money Discussions, Photography Club and Basketball teams) Generous vacation policy401(k) and Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)Catered lunches + snacks & drinksUpstart is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to ensuring that underrepresented classes receive better access to affordable credit, and are just as committed to embracing diversity and inclusion in our hiring practices. We celebrate all cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, and know that we can only become better together.https://www.upstart.com/candidate_privacy_policy Show more Show less Seniority level Associate Employment type Full-time Job function Product Management and Marketing Industries Financial Services

At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit - one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities.This position contributes to Starbucks success by assuming responsibility for the strategic value, capabilities, and performance of cross-company technology solutions in support of the Licensed Store business. We design, build, and nurture a technology ecosystem that elevates the Starbucks brand and grows our business. To be successful, the senior product manager needs to be an expert in managing complex and ambiguous initiatives while managing cross functional expectations - including but not limited to product roadmaps, feature sets, problem areas, timelines, and change requests. They need to have a passion for building the right capabilities for our business and our customers balanced with the analytical rigor to test, measure, and iterate to deliver on the best experience and business value through complex solutions that provide exceptional capabilities to drive decision making, optimization, financial performance, and operational excellence for the Licensed Store business.Summary Of Key ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities and essential job functions include, but are not limited to, the following:Partners with business stakeholders on problem definition & drive alignment on business goals, UX goals and defining target KPIs for the overall product and features. Creates user stories/requirements, works with stakeholders to identify ROI/business value; leads prioritization of backlog; Creates and maintains user personasEffectively partners and collaborates with both senior managers and working teams to position and support engagementsPrioritization and ownership across multiple deliverables and cross-team initiativesResponsible for multiple sub-products and/or one small to mid-size product. Knowledgeable in a specific product domain space within Starbucks and the overall industry.Able to manage tradeoffs on scope, resources, timeline on small to medium sized feature setsResponsible for successful execution of small to medium enhancements and new features against business goalsCommunicates effectively with technology and business teams independentlyCreates product update communications independently varying from release announcements to content for executive review and decision makingSupports team members and peers in learning technical skills and business acumenStays abreast of new technology capabilities and leverages knowledge in contributing to product solutions. Recommends and plans innovative products and features.Works with technical product managers and/or engineering to scope and prioritize upcoming projects into the roadmapCollaborates with technical working teams to apply knowledge/expertise in refining requirements, understanding technical debt and non-functional features to prioritize appropriatelyManages a cross-team product roadmapBuilds effective relationships with key stakeholders and cross functional teamsPerforms Feature Readouts with 2nd level insights (broader and deeper hypothesis driven complete analysis) per measurement plan, identify proxy data sources as needed to troubleshoot issues.QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field Demonstrated ability to work with design and engineering to deliver large cross functional business process and systems transformations across the following domains: relationship management, product development, category/marketing, supply chain planning and execution, and finance (4 years) Hands on experience in developing roadmaps, priorities, features, story outlines, writing user stories, refining product backlogs, and coordinating/prioritizing conflicting requirements in a fast-paced, changing environment with variety of stakeholders (5 years) Managing product delivery and release in an agile environment (3 years) Industry experience in a technology environment with a record of successfully delivering complex products (5 years) Leadership, creative thinking, and problem-solving skillsDrive to get things done and a desire to work in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with varied responsibilities.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. High attention to detail and the ability to effectively lead multiple projects at a timeComfortable with change and ability to adapt accordingly. This is an innovative and fast growth part of the company where products and processes evolve rapidly Teamwork skills essential; sense of humor preferredAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com. To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details Slack is where work happens. It's a collaboration hub where the right people and the right information come together, helping everyone get work done.Our Developer Platform supports this mission by providing an engagement layer connecting people and information across different software. A typical enterprise has over one thousand pieces of software, creating silos of data and events! Our goal is to empower everyone to automate admin tasks and exchange data between silos to reduce context switching, increase productivity, and improve their working life.In this role you'll work with our developer ecosystem to create delightful interactive experiences connecting third-party systems within Slack to reduce context switching and spread knowledge sharing.Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, creative, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?What You Will Be Doing Owning a product strategy and feature roadmap to deliver on the needs of people who build Slack apps across a range of technical levels and capabilities. Building an understanding of Slack app developers, both inside and outside large organizations. Creating new APIs to allow easier creation of new Slack app capabilities. Launching new services to support Slack developers and reduce friction for Slack development. You will build fundamentals that enable and grow the ecosystem of apps that connect Slack to productivity applications, together with our partner-facing teams. In tandem with engineering leadership, develop appropriate planning, prioritization, and release management processes to enable launch of new functionality for developers and Slack customers. Drive execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with partners. Prioritize and design features for a variety of personas, from non-technical Slack users to Slack power-users to developers Understanding Slack user, administrator, developer, and partner dynamics to build healthy ecosystems What you should have 3+ years of experience as a product manager working on technical products, especially APIs and developer platforms. A passion for Slack and the problems we are solving Desire to understand Slack developers and users of varying skill levels and technical capabilities - their capabilities, needs, and how they work Ability to manage complex internal and external stakeholders and find creative solutions Track record of working with engineering and partner teams: people want to work with you again Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .Salesforce welcomes all.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.On the Quantitative Tools team at Tinder, our mission is to build trustworthy, fast, and powerful tools that anybody can easily use to turn data into practical information. Our scope includes platforms that enable anyone to build and consume insights into the impacts of product and market changes and the causes for metric movements and anomalies. Engineers, designers, product managers, analysts, and executives use our tools regularly.As an Associate Product Manager, your duties will include owning the development of data products, supporting our users, and improving how we conduct data-informed decision-making. Success in this role involves partnering with diverse cross-departmental collaborators, assessing opportunities, specifying requirements, and ensuring the delivery of projects to a schedule. Meaningful experience could include a technical background, research, analysis of large data sets, design thinking, and leading projects and teams.This position reports to the Senior Product Manager of Experimentation.You will: Determine and specify product requirements, functionality, and usage by partnering with cross-functional team members (product, engineering, market, and analytics).Capture and analyze product data, including analytics, statistics, and industry trends.Develop an efficient and reliable customer feedback and communication channels.Build marketing feature launches while onboarding new hires.You have:Familiarity with quantitative research, behavioral analysis and marketing techniques; SQL a plus, not mandatory.An understanding of consumer technology and online applications.Strong time management, collaboration, and communication skills.Proven experience navigating ambiguity and finding creative solutions.Passion for Tinder and our mission to keep the magic of human connection alive.Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, applied math, cognitive, behavioral, data science, or an equivalent is preferred.As part of our team, you’ll enjoy: Working on a product that has an immediate impact on people’s lives all around the world Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Other perks and wellness benefits like a fitness membership subsidy, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance offerings, and a commuter subsidy A robust Learning + Development offering including our MentorMatch program, access to a library of 6,000+ online learning courses through Udemy, and an annual L+D stipend Access to mental health resources Fertility preservation benefits No Meeting Wednesdays and access to a wide range of product and service discounts through Perkspot Charitable donations match up to $15,000 annually Monthly and weekly interactive virtual events including Book Club, trivia with prizes and yoga workouts The opportunity to join six active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our product, and our community. We strive to make our workplace an inclusive and diverse environment, giving people from all walks of life the opportunity to have a voice. We champion and encourage those who bring different perspectives, ideas, and creativity to join our team dedicated to bringing people together across the globe. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, or other lived experience. About The CompanyIn 2008, Gwyneth Paltrow launched goop, a lifestyle platform dedicated to keeping its readership informed and inspired with tightly curated content and products. goop's expert tastemakers advise and contribute on everything from fashion, wellness, and travel, to recipes, parenting, and cultural issues. Pioneering the contextual commerce platform, goop allows readers to shop with meaning. goop is one of the rare places on the web where food, shopping, and mindfulness collide—where the ever-evolving intent is to make every choice count. We're all resource-strapped, so goop hopes to surface the very best experiences, recipes, products, and advice.With a highly engaged and loyal customer base already in place, the goop platform is rapidly expanding to include branded events, retail stores, pop-ups, a Netflix series, and an ever-growing lineup of goop private label products in addition to multi-branded shopping. The company boasts diverse and rapidly growing revenue streams across ecommerce, ad sales, retail, and experiences. goop is headquartered in Santa Monica, CA.About YouYou are passionate about the goop brand and have a strong desire to build and improve our digital product. You may already be a confident leader who has experience guiding cross-functional teams in the successful creation of products that improve the consumer experience, utilizing innovative optimization techniques to drive business impact. You lead with a data-driven and problem-solving mindset. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative culture.About The RoleIn this role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with internal and external stakeholders to enhance the website user experience through experimentation, and optimizations as well as develop new features to improve acquisition, engagement, and conversion. You will manage all aspects of product development from problem identification to launch and will be critical in supporting our overall digital product strategy and its related testing and feature roadmap. This role will report directly to the Lead Product Manager.Engage regularly with business stakeholders to gather and define new requirements, identify inefficiencies, and set expectations for in-progress roadmap items. Establish a deep understanding of the user experience, identify and fill product gaps, and generate new ideas that inspire new and existing customers by leveraging data, user research, and competitive analysis. Turn our strategic vision into reality by partnering with the engineering team and cross-functional stakeholders to create an aligned product roadmap Communicate product status, key issues, and launch plans to key stakeholders throughout the organization Partner with product designers, developers, and internal stakeholders for discovery and user research Translate business needs, user needs, and technological capabilities into user stories and product requirements working closely with the engineering and QA teams. Manage a squad and run all the ceremonies of a proper Agile scrum development cycle including stand-ups, sprint planning, and retros. Continuously iterate on our product workflows to help us work more effectively Qualifications & ExperienceExcellent Communicator: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate technical and business concepts to technical and non-technical audiences. Entrepreneurial Spirit: Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, deals well with ambiguity and focuses on delivering quantifiable business or customer value. Analytically Grounded: You define what success looks like with real data, taking into account user experience, KPIs, and how to measure progress holistically. You know every step of the user funnel. You can design, run, and interpret experiments and A/B tests Technical Problem-solver: You dive deep to understand technically complex systems to come up with creative solutions and carefully consider how changes will impact the business and customers. Growth Mindset: You acknowledge that everyone has room to grow, believe that delivering and receiving feedback is healthy, and enjoy the thrill of discovery and learning. Data Enthusiast: You use data to ground discovery efforts and prioritization decisions, discover insights, and communicate the value and impact of the work you do. Collaborative Decider: You build buy-in and involve the appropriate perspectives in the decision-making process but feel comfortable being decisive and making tough calls. Scrum Product Ownership: You can take a vision and roadmap and turn it into an impactful scrum board comprised of epics and stories that your cross-functional product teams will understand and build. You also love leading and participating in sprint reviews where results are demonstrated, not only functional but also business-impacting achievements FAQ Compensation: Competitive Market Salary DOE + Equity. Benefits: Generous health benefits package, fertility benefits and paid parental leave. Perks: "goopcation" paid company summer break, generous goop discounts, special offers with brand partners, access to custom lifestyle resources and events, and a beautiful workspace in Santa Monica Work Philosophy: At goop, we believe that creativity, innovation, and camaraderie are essential to our business, our culture, and our employee's growth and development. With our Hybrid Work Policy, we are committed to promoting collaboration, productivity, and employee well-being by maximizing the benefits of both in-person and remote work. With every aspect of this policy, goop is committed to employee health and safety and will continue to follow all federal, state, and local requirements. Type of Hire: This is a Full-Time Exempt Staff position. Other candidates, consultants, and placement agency candidates will not be considered. Job Disclosures: No applicant disclosures related to physical requirements or ADA-related considerations are relevant for this role Application Requirements: All applicants will be reviewed through Greenhouse submission. Direct submissions to the People Operations Team members will not be reviewed separately. Candidate Requirements: Applicant must have US work authorization. goop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. goop does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Direct message the job poster from VeeOne Health Cherie Thurman Connecting Healthcare Providers with Telehealth and Virtual Care Solutions Sr. Product Manager Do you want to work in an awesome culture developed by leadership from Silicon Valley startups and major healthcare systems? Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing telehealth companies in the nation? Where you won’t be micromanaged? A place with unlimited rapid career growth possibilities? This is it. About Us Based in Roseville, CA, VeeOne Health is a global telehealth company focused on virtual technology, physician services, and operations. Founded in 2016, VeeOne Health has the most advanced telemedicine solutions available for the entire continuum of care, from acute care to outpatient settings. VeeOne Health’s advanced platform powers its entire suite of solutions, allowing for healthcare systems to seamlessly deliver the highest quality, timely, and life-saving care – regardless of location. VeeOne Health’s virtual care platform is there for every step of the patient journey. Read more about us here: www.VeeOneHealth.com. Our atmosphere is fun, creative, smart, and hard-working. We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a healthcare or technology company — we’re a powerhouse that provides solutions to improve people’s lives. We’re revolutionizing the way healthcare functions, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion to help us keep on innovating. We pride ourselves on a world-class winning culture of collaboration and teamwork. We are a mission-driven company that works on what really matters — improving the quality and accessibility of healthcare globally. Everywhere you look at the healthcare technology that surrounds us you'll find one thing in common. It all relies on quality. That's why VeeOne Health is dedicated to providing healthcare solutions that are more reliable, efficient, and effective. It is because quality matters. We are confident we can deliver on this promise because of the attributes that our employees embody. We're ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent, and we're committed to learning. These values enable us to tackle some of the toughest challenges on the planet for our customers, never losing sight of what matters. Who we are looking for? We’re looking for candidates who have the following:Ability to multitask and work effectively across projects/products while liaising with various stakeholders.Self-Motivated team player who has high emotional intelligence and a history of guiding product roadmaps (preferably in the health care space).A deep understanding of and experience working in Software-as-a-Service (SaaS).Start-up minded; an out-of-the box thinker who is unafraid to wear multiple hats and finds opportunities in the face of uncertainty and change.Approaches challenges with dogged tenacity to overcome obstacles.Possesses highly effective communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.Compensation & Benefits Competitive compensation package (equity included) along with benefits (health, dental, vision). Responsibilities· Wear multiple hats and collaborate closely with engineering, marketing, sales, business development, customer success, QA, and other teams when necessary.· Translate the product strategy into detailed requirements for designers to do high-fidelity prototypes and for the final product development done by engineering.· Create product strategy documents that describe business and high-level use cases, technical requirements, and ROI.· Thoroughly analyze market data to develop sales strategies and clearly define product objectives for effective marketing communications plans.· Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates VeeOne Health and its features across primary market segments, specifically in the RPM space.· Drive the execution of product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch. Qualifications· Proven track record with a minimum of 2+ years of experience as product manager (preferable in the telemedicine space).· Bachelor’s in computer science, engineering, product design, or equivalent.· Proven experience in driving products from inception to launch and overseeing all elements of the product development lifecycle.· Strong proficiency for technical workflow tools (Azure DevOps, JIRA, etc.), and the agile/scrum development process. Preferred Qualifications· 5+ years of product management or relevant work experience.· Experience in health tech, specifically in inpatient/outpatient, direct to patient, and remote patient monitoring (RPM) and virtual-care-as-a-service (VCaaS). · Certified Product Owner (CSPO).If you have a real passion for product management and healthcare technology, this is just the opportunity you need to launch a successful career at VeeOne Health. Ready to connect your skills and knowledge with our innovative health tech solutions? It starts with you. Explore our opportunities and apply today. Show more Show less Employment type Full-time
